title: How to Remove Cream Stains

steps.headline: Sponge off the excess cream with a damp cloth.
Rinse the fabric in cold water.
Soak the fabric.
steps.description: Either soak in a biological detergent or make a mix using borax and water. Leave to soak for about an hour.

steps.headline: Remove and allow to dry.
steps.description: If the stain has lifted, wash as normal.

steps.headline: If the stain has not lifted yet, rub dry-cleaning fluid on any residue left.
steps.description: Rinse the fluid off, then wash as normal.

steps.headline: Dab the stain using dry-cleaning fluid.
Use denatured alcohol to dab off any remaining stain.

text: Washable fabric Sponge off the excess cream with a damp cloth.  Rinse the fabric in cold water.  Soak the fabric. Either soak in a biological detergent or make a mix using borax and water. Leave to soak for about an hour. Remove and allow to dry. If the stain has lifted, wash as normal. If the stain has not lifted yet, rub dry-cleaning fluid on any residue left. Rinse the fluid off, then wash as normal. Non-washable fabric Dab the stain using dry-cleaning fluid.  Use denatured alcohol to dab off any remaining stain.  Leave to dry.
